§ String Case

⸺ by Charles Iliya Krempeaux

The **string case** describes how spacing and casing is done in a phrase.

Different types of **string casing** include:

• [[lower-case]] — example: **hello world**
• [[title-case]] — example: **Hello World**
• [[upper-case]] — example: **HELLO WORLD**

• [[camel-case]] — example: **helloWorld**
• [[upper-camel-case]] — example: **HelloWorld**

• [[snake-case]] — example: **hello_world**
• [[upper-snake-case]] — example: **HELLO_WORLD**
• [[title-snake-case]] — example: **Hello_World**

• [[llama-case]] — example: **helloworld**
• [[upper-llama-case]] — example: **HELLOWORLD**

• [[slug-case]] — example: **hello-world**
• [[title-slug-case]] — example: **Hello-World**
• [[upper-slug-case]] — example: **HELLO-WORLD**

§§ Alternative Names

Some **string case** names have alternative names.

• [[pascal-case]] — example: **HelloWorld** (same as **upper-camel-case**)

• [[const-case]] — example: **HELLO_WORLD** (same as **upper-snake-case**)
• [[screaming-snake-case]] — example: **HELLO_WORLD** (same as **upper-snake-case**)

• [[kebab-case]] — example: **hello-world** (same as **slug-case**)
• [[lisp-case]] — example: **hello-world** (same as **slug-case**)
• [[property-case]] — example: **hello-world** (same as **slug-case**)

• [[header-case]] — example: **Hello-World** (same as **title-slug-case**)
